intro: Richella gracilipes, commonly known as the slender richella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in the early spring. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
